author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Secretary says news report in a business daily is baseless

Countering a report in a business daily that alleged that the Ministry of Earth Sciences had blamed the Tamil Nadu Government’s “slow response” for the December 2015 flooding in Chennai and its surroundings, Chief Secretary K. Gnanadesikan on Thursday said the Ministry has denied any role in it.

‘Baseless report’

In a statement, the Chief Secretary said the news report was baseless and was picked up by other media subsequently “without verifying the veracity of the claims” made therein. According to him, the State sought the response of the Ministry about the veracity of the claim that it had compiled a report blaming Tamil Nadu’s slow response for the flooding. K.J. Ramesh, Adviser and Scientist ‘G’ of Ministry of Earth Sciences, had replied stating, “It is to clarify that no such report exists as claimed to have been prepared by this Ministry on recent TN floods. Accordingly, the Ministry fully disowns the inferences articulated by the reporter...”
title: ‘Centre denies giving report on TN floods’
